interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: Billion Dollar Bully Review Date: 2020/06/18 Categories: Documentary, Arts, Entertainment, and Culture Product Description: ["Today consumers Yelp everything from restaurants to dentists; plumbers to surgeons. The small business community sees Yelp's sales tactic as extortion. Does Yelp genuinely have an interest in helping people support the best local businesses, or are they a pay-to-play advertising platform?"] Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Kaylie Milliken'], 'Producers': ['Kaylie Milliken'], 'Starring': ['Davide Cerretini', 'Amy Lane', 'Danny Teran']} Review Text: Point of the Documentary: Reviews are corrupt.
Amazon: So . . . . whatja think?

Great Documentary. God, I could not stand the snarky tone of the Yelp reps on the phone, I felt like punting them from here on the West Coast all the way to Rhode Island. And to think the person actually exists. And that Jackie Reses phone call- so glad she was exposed.

I wish this documentary not so much put Yelp out of business, but held them more accountable. And I will take the advice of the person in the doc who said don't START advertising with them, because they won't let you stop. And it IS the company culture, those are young reps under pressure from within to get a stupid cow bell ring instead of enough money to pay their rent in SF.

They're a monopoly, take them down, and I am going to visit that guys' Italian restaurant in Richmond, and if you know Richmond, that's saying something. Review Title: Oh The Irony Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------

Diner (DVD) Steve Guttenberg (Actor), Daniel Stern (Actor) Rated: R Format: DVD Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Comedy ['Diner (DVD)', "The film that launched successful careers for Kevin Bacon, Ellen Barkin, Paul Reiser, Mickey Rourke and more! It's a lively, poignant tale of friends trying to recapture their lost innocence in 1959 Baltimore.", ']]>'] {'Genre': 'Drama, Comedy', 'Format': 'Closed-captioned, Multiple Formats, Color, Letterboxed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Ellen Barkin, Steve Guttenberg, Mickey Rourke, Paul Reiser, Tim Daly, Barry Levinson, Jerry Weintraub, Mark Johnson, Kevin Bacon, Daniel SternEllen Barkin, Steve Guttenberg, Mickey Rourke, Paul Reiser, Tim Daly, Barry Levinson, Jerry Weintraub, Mark Johnson, Kevin Bacon, Daniel Stern See more', 'Initial release date': '2004-02-03', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Mono), French (Dolby Digital 2.0 Mono)', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.45 x 5.61 x 7.54 inches; 2.08 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'MFR012569507722#VG', 'Director': 'Barry Levinson', 'Media Format': 'Closed-captioned, Multiple Formats, Color, Letterboxed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 50 minutes', 'Release date': 'February 3, 2004', 'Actors': 'Steve Guttenberg, Daniel Stern, Mickey Rourke, Kevin Bacon, Tim Daly', 'Dubbed': 'French', 'Subtitles': 'English, French', 'Producers': 'Jerry Weintraub, Mark Johnson', 'Studio': 'Studio Distribution Services', 'Writers': 'Barry Levinson', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} I got this movie to watch with my mom because she grew up on the East Coast around this time. It's a sweet movie with a little R ish material, not too much, but all in all a nice escape, and a movie that stands up to rewatching. It's a sweet movie with a little R ish material {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Henry Singer'], 'Producers': ['Henry Singer'], 'Studio': ['XiveTV']} They should retitle this one "The Most Narcissistic Photographer in the History of Photographs". This guy tried to make the entire story about him, a guy who pushed a button on a machine. Line after line of how he was Picasso, how his photograph compared to Pulitzer Prize winning photos, every last thing the guy said was about himself. I defy you to find a sentence without the word "I" or "me" in it. The Most Narcissistic Photographer in the History of Photographs {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Stephanie Kaim'], 'Producers': ['Irène Challand', 'Claire Colart', 'Sandrine Delegiewicz', 'Stéphane Haumant', 'Gaspard Lamunière', 'Daniel Leconte', 'Andreas Lemos', 'Émilie Raffoul', 'Olivier Stroh'], 'Studio': ['MagellanTV']} Out after 40 seconds. I at first couldn't realize if the video was warped, or the guy had a speech impediment. No way could I make it through 90 minutes of that. Out after 40 seconds. I at first couldn't realize ... {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'frightening scenes', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['None'], 'Starring': ['Ruth Blackwell'], 'Studio': ['Independent Documentary']} Water faucets running and junk scattered on the floor. That HAD to be a ghost! I now believe in ghosts! This was a lower budget Blair Witch Project that was hoping a large percentage of the people were too young to remember The Blair Witch Project. The only reason it barely made it to three stars is that it's a cute couple. And they did get me to watch the whole thing. This was very terrible. This was very terrible. {'Content advisory': ['Alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Lee Schloss'], 'Producers': ['Mike Bocchetti'], 'Starring': ['Mike Bocchetti', 'Artie Lange', 'Sal the Stockbroker']} The quality of the video could be better, but the quality of Mike could not. He's got a heart of gold, and if you want to see who he is, I recommend youtubing "Mike Bocchetti and the weather". Crisp video quality, and Mike never has a bad word to say about anyone. His true comic talents are brought out by Artie Lange on Artie's show when he does the weather. Please watch, I've seen it so many times. Mike is a 5 star person {'Content advisory': ['Foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['CJ Wallis'], 'Producers': ['Mallory Kennedy', 'CJ Wallis'], 'Starring': ['Ted Slauson', 'Bob Barker', 'Roger Dobkowitz']} The guy who does the narrating (the principle subject) has this style that doesn't seem like he'd like any kind of game show at all. But it kind of grows on you. There is a surprising amount of footage that captures all of his appearances. I thought there would be a little more scandal to it. It really should be titled The Contestant Who Knew a Fair Amount. There were some tones of stalker in him, but that helped my fascination. And Holly didn't have to fear him because well, ya know, I mean- ya know? She knew.

Also, at the time when he was young, he was a good looking guy, I think that's how the models kind of liked him. In his prime, it wasn't weird to ask for a kiss from Holly. It was really sad to see Bob Barker get older, because you see the pics of him when he was younger, and you just couldn't look more alive. For even someone that good looking to get old, damn, what's that say for the rest of us.

But I highly recommend this doc for sure for sure watch it. A really good documentary {'Content advisory': ['Violence'], 'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Sally Howell'], 'Producers': ['Heather Dreiling', 'Eric Schotz', 'Kathy Williamson'], 'Studio': ['MagellanTV']} The narrator, who looks like the kind of guy who got beat up a lot in grammar school, is a little too alarmist, and rehashes stuff the main authority on sugar has already talked about. This goofball says he is serious about exercise and then says who needs a gym and walks up a hill with rocks. Wow. I've lived in England, and just like the rest of English TV, this seems like, I don't know- practice television, and a practice documentary. Also what I've noticed in English documentaries, they seem to be fascinated by the narrator WALKING. It must be a luxury in the UK to walk, or it must denote thinking. Anyway, I couldn't make it all the way through. Couldn't make it to the end {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['---'], 'Producers': ['Paul Dechant'], 'Starring': ['Paul Dechant']} The way we think about sugar is going to change; but not from this micro-mentary. I had a longer report about sugar in 5th grade. In about 300 seconds, this snippet talks about how there is sugar in food, and they made labels to know how much.

I have changed the way I think about sugar. Also, I wish I had the last 5 minutes of my life back. Way too long {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Austin Meyer'], 'Producers': ['Austin Meyer'], 'Starring': ['Austin Meyer', 'Peter Braxton', 'Alex Charro'], 'Studio': ['AMC Plus Documentaries']} This had me thinking the next day. Somebody told me about it, and I couldn't wait to watch it, even though I have nothing to do with patents. It's well told on a low budget and you'll find out why the budget is low. I could only slightly see the point of the other side, it was cool of Oscar Meyer to include them too, but in the balance, these patent trolls are very terrible people. Best Doc in a long while {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Michal Siewierski'], 'Producers': ['Peter Eastwood', 'Nicky Taylor', 'Gwyn Whittaker'], 'Starring': ['John Mackey', 'Rich Roll', 'Rip Esselstyn'], 'Studio': ['Gravitas Ventures']} I'm going to wait for the English speaking version. Not sure Billion Dollar Bully Documentary, Arts, Entertainment, and Culture ["Today consumers Yelp everything from restaurants to dentists; plumbers to surgeons. The small business community sees Yelp's sales tactic as extortion. Does Yelp genuinely have an interest in helping people support the best local businesses, or are they a pay-to-play advertising platform?"] {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Kaylie Milliken'], 'Producers': ['Kaylie Milliken'], 'Starring': ['Davide Cerretini', 'Amy Lane', 'Danny Teran']} Point of the Documentary: Reviews are corrupt.
Amazon: So . . . . whatja think?

Great Documentary. God, I could not stand the snarky tone of the Yelp reps on the phone, I felt like punting them from here on the West Coast all the way to Rhode Island. And to think the person actually exists. And that Jackie Reses phone call- so glad she was exposed.

I wish this documentary not so much put Yelp out of business, but held them more accountable. And I will take the advice of the person in the doc who said don't START advertising with them, because they won't let you stop. And it IS the company culture, those are young reps under pressure from within to get a stupid cow bell ring instead of enough money to pay their rent in SF.

They're a monopoly, take them down, and I am going to visit that guys' Italian restaurant in Richmond, and if you know Richmond, that's saying something. Oh The Irony
profile:
**Updated User Summary:**

The user continues to showcase a strong affinity for comedy films blending drama and nostalgia, focusing on personal connections and cultural experiences. Their discerning taste emphasizes the need for well-rounded narratives and deep character exploration, and they maintain a clear intolerance for self-absorbed protagonists. Recent interactions have highlighted an increased demand for high-quality filmmaking that prioritizes emotional engagement and narrative clarity.

The user’s latest review of a thought-provoking documentary reflects their appreciation for storytelling that fosters critical reflection and sheds light on relevant social issues. They exhibit a pragmatic approach to content accessibility, favoring options for English audio and subtitles, reinforcing their commitment to multi-language support in viewing experiences. Despite a lower rating for some content, their expectations remain firmly rooted in superior storytelling and production quality.

Overall, this profile indicates a sophisticated viewer dedicated to exploring films that evoke warmth and tackle complex themes while upholding rigorous execution. With a growing interest in documentaries that prompt reflection on cultural or societal dynamics, the user seeks narratives that resonate on multiple levels, emphasizing quality and accountability in both arts and entertainment.
